g.text: Local tiny wallet explorer: Trying to only use P2P systems
User connects wallet to local software
Some API provider with private index
Determines `0xf1` Chapter of index is needed
Inspect transaction IDs from Chapter locally
This limb may be thought of as a derivative
of the Unchained Index (or if Unchained had this
BONUS: User pins and shares local index DB.
Infrastructure teams can pin and share too.
Use CIDs to get relevant parts of the index
Inspect transaction IDs from chunks locally
BONUS: User pins and shares downloaded chunks.
TrueBlocks can pin and share too.
Get info for contracts that events came from
Retrieve source code from IPFS or Swarm
Not worth pinning a single contract.
Relies on others to pin the entire database.
Use ABI and Userdocs to create translation
API provider maintains DB but is a
central point of vulnerability to the system
Download the relevant portion of the database
BONUS: User pins and shares local DB.
Sourcify team can add, pin and share too.
Maintainer adds new data, but is
BONUS: User pins and shares local DB.
4byte team can add, pin and share too.
Try to parse variable names and types
- Tx1 details: swap token x on contract y
- Tx2 details: deposit x on protocol y
- Tx3 details: sell x on market y

g.id: link_start_User connects wallet to local software\nto get address: `0xf145..f00d`

link_Inspect transaction IDs from Chapter locally

itself had this shardable architecture)

link_Get transaction ids:
eth_getTransactionByBlockAndIndex(block_num, tx_index)
-> tx_hash_Get receipts:
eth_getTransactionReceipt(tx_hash)
-> log_topic, contract_address
